project.title: About the Project
project.description: OrganAIzer is an open-source project developed by Patrick Hess in Munich. The goal is to connect modern AI technology with practical meeting planning.
project.openSource: The project is open source and welcomes contributors. Contact and bug reports can be submitted via the website organAIzer.app.
project.license: License: OrganAIzer is published under a free license. See repository for details.

goals: Expand development team by 5 new members

team.background: Patrick Hess is an experienced software developer and AI enthusiast with over 15 years of experience in developing scalable applications.
team.vision: His vision is to revolutionize the way teams collaborate through intelligent automation and intuitive tools.
approachItems: User-centric design with continuous feedback loops
Performance optimization for teams of all sizes
communityItems: Open Source on GitHub with 50+ contributors
Monthly community calls for feature discussions
Bug bounty program for security researchers

story.title: Our Story
story.content: OrganAIzer was born out of frustration with inefficient meetings and lack of task traceability. Our founder, Patrick Hess, recognized the potential of AI to overcome these challenges and create a solution that truly makes teams more productive.
story.growth: Since our inception, we have continuously evolved based on user feedback and the latest technological advancements. We are proud to offer a platform that not only optimizes meetings but also improves collaboration and communication within teams.
